object.name: window
object.note: The ECMAScript environment's global object. All objects, properties and methods are also available as global variables.

property.name: event
property.note: Returns the current event or null if there is no current event.

property.name: parent
property.note: Returns same window if there is no parent window.

property.name: frameElement
property.note: Returns null if document is not in a frame or iframe.

property.name: ENTITY_REFERENCE_NODE
property.note: Nodes of this type are not supported.

property.name: appName
property.note: Value depends on current "Identify as" setting.

property.name: appVersion
property.note: Value depends on current "Identify as" setting.

property.name: userAgent
property.note: Value depends on current "Identify as" setting.

property.name: all
property.note: Collection of all descendant Element nodes.

property.name: children
property.note: Collection of all child Element nodes.

exception.name: NAMESPACE_ERR
exception.note: Only thrown when there is a prefix but no namespace URI.

exception.name: NOT_SUPPORTED
exception.note: Never thrown since the feature "XML" is supported.

exception.name: NAMESPACE_ERR
exception.note: Only thrown when there is a prefix but no namespace URI.

exception.name: NOT_SUPPORTED
exception.note: Never thrown since the feature "XML" is supported.

method.name: getElementById
method.note: Also returns elements by HTML name attribute.

class.name: MessageBox
class.note: This class also works as a collection and can be indexed. The objects inside it are of the class "Message"

property.name: read
property.note: Only present if it's a received message.

property.name: method
property.note: Only present if it's a received message.
